Structs/ImageInfo.html#/s:7SkiaKit9Image.abstract: Number of bits used by the colorType (this is bytesPerPixel multiplied by 8)

Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.name: clamp
Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.abstract: Replicate the edge color if the shader draws outside of its original bounds.

Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.name: repeats
Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.abstract: Repeat the shader’s image horizontally and vertically.

Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.name: mirror
Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.abstract: Repeat the shader’s image horizontally and vertically, alternating mirror images so that adjacent images always seam.

Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.name: decal
Enums/ShaderTileMode.html#/s:7SkiaKit14S.abstract: Only draw within the original domain, return transparent-black everywhere else.

Enums/FontStyleSlant.html#/s:7SkiaKit14F.name: italic
Enums/FontStyleSlant.html#/s:7SkiaKit14F.abstract: The italic font slant, in which the slanted characters appear as they were designed.

Enums/FontStyleSlant.html#/s:7SkiaKit14F.name: oblique
Enums/FontStyleSlant.html#/s:7SkiaKit14F.abstract: The characters in an oblique font are artificially slanted. The slant is achieved by performing a shear transformation on the characters from a normal font. When a true italic font is not available on a computer or printer, an oblique style can generated from the normal font and used to simulate an italic font.

Enums/StrokeCap.html#/s:7SkiaKit9StrokeC.name: butt
Enums/StrokeCap.html#/s:7SkiaKit9StrokeC.abstract: no stroke extension - the default stroke value

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: unknown
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: If set, encoding format and size is unknown.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: alpha8
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 8-bit byte pixel encoding that represents transparency. Value of zero is completely transparent; a value of 255 is completely opaque.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgb565
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 16-bit word pixel encoding that contains five bits of blue, six bits of green, and five bits of red.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: argb4444
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 16-bit word pixel encoding that contains four bits of alpha, four bits of blue, four bits of green, and four bits of red.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgba8888
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 32-bit word pixel encoding that contains eight bits of red, eight bits of green, eight bits of blue, and eight bits of alpha.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgb888x
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 32-bit word pixel encoding that contains eight bits of red, eight bits of green, eight bits of blue, and eight unused bits.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: bgra8888
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 32-bit word pixel encoding that contains eight bits of blue, eight bits of green, eight bits of red, and eight bits of alpha.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgba1010102
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 32-bit word pixel encoding that contains ten bits of red, ten bits of green, ten bits of blue, and two bits of alpha.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgb101010x
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 32-bit word pixel encoding that contains ten bits of red, ten bits of green, ten bits of blue, and two unused bits.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: gray8
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 8-bit byte pixel encoding that equivalent to equal values for red, blue, and green, representing colors from black to white.

Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.name: rgbaF16
Enums/ColorType.html#/s:7SkiaKit9ColorTy.abstract: Stores 64-bit word pixel encoding that contains 16 bits of blue, 16 bits of green, 16 bits of red, and 16 bits of alpha. Each component is encoded as a half float.

Enums/ColorType.html.name: ColorType
Enums/ColorType.html.abstract: Describes how pixel bits encode color. A pixel may be an alpha mask, a grayscale, Red Green and Blue (RGB), or

Enums/AlphaType.html.name: AlphaType
Enums/AlphaType.html.abstract: Describes how to interpret the alpha component of a pixel. A pixel may

Enums/PaintStyle.html.name: PaintStyle
Enums/PaintStyle.html.abstract: Set Style to fill, stroke, or both fill and stroke geometry.

Enums/StrokeCap.html.name: StrokeCap
Enums/StrokeCap.html.abstract: Cap draws at the beginning and end of an open path contour.

Enums/StrokeJoin.html.name: StrokeJoin
Enums/StrokeJoin.html.abstract: Join specifies how corners are drawn when a shape is stroked. Join

Enums/PathDirection.html.name: PathDirection
Enums/PathDirection.html.abstract: PathDirection describes whether contour is clockwise or counterclockwise.

Enums/FontStyleWeight.html.name: FontStyleWeight
Enums/FontStyleWeight.html.abstract: Refers to the density of a typeface, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.

Enums/FontStyleWidth.html.name: FontStyleWidth
Enums/FontStyleWidth.html.abstract: Predefined font widths for use with Typeface, these values match the usWidthClass from the OpenType specification. These are numbers from 1 to 9, lower numbers represent narrower widths, higher numbers indicate wider widths.

Enums/ShaderTileMode.html.name: ShaderTileMode
Enums/ShaderTileMode.html.abstract: Indications on how the shader should handle drawing outside the original bounds.

Enums/PixelGeometry.html.name: PixelGeometry
Enums/PixelGeometry.html.abstract: Description of how the LCD strips are arranged for each pixel. If this is unknown, or the
